intro: Cienkowskiella brachystemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cienkowskiella, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Cienkowskiella brachystemon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
